result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Conner L. Vande Weerd

records.addlTxt:
Court calls @ 1:40 PM/ RM 203, 22CF155 & 22CF181.  Defendant Conner L. Vande Weerd appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court for Conner L. Vande Weerd.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Atty Cirilli has received a copy of the criminal complaint, waives reading, waives time limits on P.H. and requests Status conference. State has no objection. Court questions if Def. would like to waive time limits on P.H. Def. confirms. Court accepts waiver of time limits. State has complied with victims rights. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Wrong case number, resubmitted by Law Firm

3:26 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Conner L. Vande Weerd appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has contacted PD Office and does qualify. Def. continues to ask for counsel. Court questions if Def. would like to waive time limits for P.H. Def. confirms and would like to wait for counsel. Court accepts waiver of time limits and finds good cause. Court also calls 22CF181 with same appearances. Court finds good cause to go past time limits for P.H. on 22CF181. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. 
No use of alcohol. 
No driving. 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

Court calls @ 1:27 PM 22CF155 and 22CF181. Defendant Conner L. Vande Weerd appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaints, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. has an Atty. on prior matters. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. Court quashes warrants. Court questions if there is a victim in cases. State has complied with victim rights and questions maximum cash bond. Court responds. State notes Def. prior record and gives bail bond recommendations and requests $100,000.00 cash bond with conditions of No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No driving, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State has been in contact with Def. Atty. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court questions previous bond poster. Def. responds. Court considers bail bond factors and orders $100,000.00 cash bond with conditions of No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No use of alcohol, No driving, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
